definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: Her national identity card, she said, had been changed to reflect the false birth-date.
sentences.chinese: 她说她的身份证上的出生日期被改了。

sentences.english: Therefore, use the birth or creation date in the database.
sentences.chinese: 因而，要在数据库中使用出生日期或创建日期。
填写国家，出生日期，和性别。

sentences.english: The American president's birthday is August 4, 1961, making him an ox.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马的出生日期是1961年8月4日，肖牛。

sentences.english: The age of a person is usually reckoned from his or her date of birth.
sentences.chinese: 一个人的年龄一般是从他的或她的出生日期算起。

sentences.english: A person's zodiacal sign is connected to his or her birth date.
sentences.chinese: 一个人的黄道带的标志是连接到他或她的出生日期。
哪项是四蒂的出生日期？

sentences.english: Converting dates of birth to ages proved more difficult.
sentences.chinese: 将出生日期转换为年龄有点儿困难。

definition: one's native place/place of ancestry/registered birthplace
variant of 身份證號碼|身份证号码[shen1 fen4 zheng4 hao4 ma3]/I.D. number
